channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Damaged keep left sign, 20th November
item.description:
This damaged sign has had a temporary alternative placed in front of it. I know it has been like that for 2 years, as my son repositioned the temporary sign when it was blown over in the wind before Christmas 2021! High time that Glos County Council sorted this out permanently, as it is an eyesore in a Conservation area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Park, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There have been barriers leaning against tree roots at 3 locations at the end of this road for at least 12months, and a barrier is currently obstructing the pavement, 20th November
item.description:
At the end of Bournside Road, close to the junction with Hatherley Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Bournside Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Area of road surface has sunk across full width of Coberley Road, 20th November
item.description:
Directly opposite the road entrance to Old Dowmans Farm an area approximately 60cm wide running across the full width of the carriageway on Coberley Road has sunk as the result of the installation of a service pipe under the main road. The installation of the pipe was performed in 2021 or earlier, and the surface of the road above this has been gradually sinking ever since. It is now at a depth that causes a significant hazard to traffic travelling across it and results in great difficulty for vehicles to safely turn into Old Dowmans Farm. The sunken area fills with rainwater frequently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Street, Coberley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Base/stu4mp/remnant of snapped off (& missing!) recycled plastic anti-parking/vehicular over-ride bollard/post (only 1 remains now when there were once 3!) is proud of f/w surface by c.70mm and therefore poses a significant trip hazard esp for elderly or children - what are Ringway's inspectors looking at when they walk these f/w's?! Act now to prevent a personal injury & resultant claim - public safety issue!!!, 20th November
item.description:
Manchester Way (no street nameplate so your Amey's Ringway's inspector may struggle to find it given they've missed this for so long - give them a map!), on south side of street where BRICK wall commences at side of n.52 Granville St - 'front' of f/w surface just behind kerbline.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Granville Street, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Failed street light, 20th November
item.description:
Street light outside number 2 Oakland avenue is not working and has been faulty for over 2 weeks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Oakland Avenue, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Worst bit of road in Cheltenham, 20th November
item.description:
The stretch of road from the T junction by the nursery, up to the top of the S curve is honestly a shamble. You have filled in the potholes with temporary surfaces which erode away by nightfall. Everytime I drive on this bit of road (I.e. twice a day), I pray that my poor old car doesn't break. I'm skint and I can afford to repair something if it breaks due to this shocking bit of road. It would be smoother to drive across a ploughed field. Please sort this out, we pay taxes and get to enjoy roads which have been left to ruin since their creation... where is my money going???
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain opposite school on Battledown Approach totally blocked. Tried your drains reports option and got nowhere so using this option, 20th November
item.description:
It is the upper sotrm drain of the set opposite Holy Apostles School. Is choked with leaves and mud etc. Not helped by SUVs parking on it at school start and end times.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battledown Approach, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in pavement problem, 20th November
item.description:
large pothole at the side of Nazareth House Cheltenham land.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet more potholes, 20th November
item.description:
Yet again, directly outside my home, 17 Cromwell Road, more potholes have developed. Yet again these are causing a large amount of stones to build up on the edge of the road which are catapulted onto my property, and cars causing DAMAGE. I also have to drive directly over the holes when reversing into my drive. Why on earth can't you just repair the defects properly and fully? Would this not be a better use of public funds than having to attend over and over and over again? The situation is not helped by enormous regular lorries from Mira which literally shake my entire house. I imagine these also cause or aggravate the already poorly maintained road. The size of these numerous holes is increasing on a daily basis. They need fixing now. And when you do, please do NOT leave a load of stones on the road, as you did last time. I had to clear these all up myself. They are a hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Cromwell Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 Drains could do with sucking out, 20th November
item.description:
2 drains below wall of churchyard 2 drains either side of The Plough Inn A team of volunteers worked in St Mary's churchyard, one of which tasks was to remove Horse-chestnut leaves from the gutter. Obscured drain grilles were exposed. Material was seen below. Mill Street floods in winter rains.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Street, Prestbury, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Leaning lamp post on the bridge over the A417, 19th November
item.description:
There is a lamp post which is leaning significantly to the left (visible when driving down the A417 towards junctions with the M5) on the Shurdington Road as it crosses over the A417. The lamp post is on the bridge close to the slip road onto the heading towards the junctions with the M5.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road Junction, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deteriorating road surface and potholes, 19th November
item.description:
The road surface just down the hill on Old Bath Road with the junction with Leckhampton Road is steadily deteriorating and there are a series of potholes in the middle of the carriageway. The position of these is such that they cannot be avoided when turning into Old Bath Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 381, Old Bath Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
